Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2012 12:05AM Ambolyne wrote: Well, my Mammogram was normal.  Had to have a spot view done, but it was just tissue from my punch biopsy.  The breast ultrasound came back normal too.  What a relief.  I am however having to go back for more blood work. Something was found and I have to do more testing, but no one has told me what we are looking for.  Just thought I would update you all that my Mammo/Ultrasound were both normal.
Posts.Title: Mammogram scheduled Ambolyne Ambolyne

Posts.Content: Ambolyne wrote: Well, after 15 months of a weird rash on my breast, I finally got a doctor that is going to get to the bottom of it.  I'm nervous for my Mammogram.  I'm only 30, but I know I'm not the first one at 30 that could have breast cancer.  To be honest, I hope there is at least an answer out of this.  We have tired 3 oral medications, about 9 topical creams, ointments and steroids and all have had minimal effects on my rash.  It has now caused toughening of the skin.  It itches, burns, warm to the touch and bleeds.  I'm not really sure what to expect for my Mammogram.  I'm going in there thinking oh it's going to be nothing, but I'm not sure if that's the way to go in there.  I'm afraid if I go in thinking it's nothing, it's going to be something bad.  But at the same time I don't want to worry my self sick and it was all for nothing.  Agh, the waiting game.  The latest med I'm on is actually for roseca.  It makes me feel sick, but at least I've seen a slight improvement.  That is typical though and in a few days it will be burning hot, itchy and oozing again, I'm sure.  I just hope the Radiologist takes my case serious and REALLY looks at my pictures and doesn't brush it off.  My doctor said I would know at my Mammo if it was normal or not and if they found something they would automatically biopsy.  I think that is what I'm most nervous about.  Agh.  I'm rambling.  Anyone have any thoughts or words of advice I welcome it.  Thanks! Posts.Title: Mammogram scheduled Ambolyne Ambolyne

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2012 03:11PM Ambolyne wrote: No I wasn't aware of that. Thank you so much. I will be discussing it with my PCP on thursday if my mammogram is negative.
